title: Magic And The Supernatural
content:
From a book published in 1964 by Spring Books, London. The slight splaying of the M’s outer legs is unique, as is the P’s relatively low waist line.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205015218im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/scan167_5044.jpg)

 [‹ Hand written, graffiti style...](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205015218/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45913 "Go to previous forum topic") [Unknown Sans Serif (Futura esque) ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205015218/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45906 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Nick Sherman

comments.content:
Nice. Not a perfect match, but definitely close.

The most info I found about Placard was that “the Placard Condensed font family is based on drawings received from Germany” (from [its page on fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205015218/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/detail.htm?pid=205300)).  
If anyone has any more info on the face, I’d be curious to hear it.
